title: Porsche 911 Carrera 4S facelift revealed in 3 body styles
description: The facelift for the current 992-gen Porsche 911 Carrera 4S has been revealed and it is available in coupe, convertible and Targa top body styles. The AWD Carrera 4S slots above the Carrera S, but below the GTS T-Hybrid in the 911’s international line-up. 2025 911 C Carrera 4S Coupe is a 2-seater; Cabriolet and Targa are 2+2 seaters 911 Carrera 4S facelift gets 480hp flat-six engine from Carrera S Claimed 0-100kph in 3.1s with optional Sport Chrono pack and Launch Control 2025 Porsche 911 Carrera 4S exterior and interior changes Gets more standard features than the Carrera S The exterior of the 911 Carrera 4S facelift is more or less identical to the Carrera S – from the staggered 20-inch front and 21-inch rear alloys to the wide rear arches and large intakes. However, the 4S gets is also available in the Targa body style, unlike the S. Compared to the S, the Carrera 4S’ interior comes with leather upholstery on the seats, headrests, dashboard and doors as standard, along with Matrix LED headlights and wireless charging. As is typical of current 911 Carrera Coupe models, the Carrera 4S comes as a two-seater, with the option to add rear seats for no additional cost. The Cabriolet and Targa get rear seats as standard. 2025 Porsche 911 Carrera 4S engine and performance 480hp flat-six engine is only available with an 8-speed dual-clutch auto Like the Carrera S, the 4S models use the 3.0-litre twin-turbo flat six that produces 480hp (30hp more than its predecessor) and 529Nm of peak torque. Porsche claims a 0-100kph time of 3.1 seconds with the optional Sport Chrono pack and Launch Control system, and a top speed of 307kph. The turbocharged flat-six engine comes with an 8-speed dual-clutch automatic as standard, which send power to all four wheels. The new sports exhaust seen on the Carrera S also features on the 4S. 911 Carrera 4S Targa gets rear-wheel steering as standard The 911 Carrera 4S also shares its 408mm front disc and 380mm rear disc brakes with the Carrera S and GTS models. While the Targa version gets rear-wheel steering as standard, the Coupe and Cabriolet have it as an optional extra. Porsche Ceramic Composite Brakes (PCCB) and the brand’s sport suspension pack (which lowers the ride height by 10mm) are also available as options. Porsche 911 India details 911 on sale in India in Carrera and Carrera 4 GTS variants There’s no word yet on when Porsche India will introduce the 992.2 911 Carrera 4S in our country. At the moment, the current Porsche 911 is on sale in India in Carrera (Rs 2.11 crore) and Carrera 4 GTS T-Hybrid (Rs 2.84 crore) variants. Also see: Porsche 911 GT3 records fastest Nurburgring lap for a manual car Porsche 911, Cayenne and more at BIC: Straight outta Stuttgart Porsche 911 Carrera vs BMW M4 Competition: Specifications comparison
author: Rivan RS
excerpt: 992.2 Porsche 911 Carrera 4S gets the same 480hp flat-six engine as the Carrera S.

html:
992.2 Porsche 911 Carrera 4S gets the same 480hp flat-six engine as the Carrera S.

The facelift for the current 992-gen Porsche 911 Carrera 4S has been revealed and it is available in coupe, convertible and Targa top body styles. The AWD Carrera 4S slots above the Carrera S, but below the GTS T-Hybrid in the 911’s international line-up.

  1. 2025 911 C Carrera 4S Coupe is a 2-seater; Cabriolet and Targa are 2+2 seaters
  2. 911 Carrera 4S facelift gets 480hp flat-six engine from Carrera S
  3. Claimed 0-100kph in 3.1s with optional Sport Chrono pack and Launch Control

2025 Porsche 911 Carrera 4S exterior and interior changes

Gets more standard features than the Carrera S

The exterior of the 911 Carrera 4S facelift is more or less identical to the Carrera S – from the staggered 20-inch front and 21-inch rear alloys to the wide rear arches and large intakes. However, the 4S gets is also available in the Targa body style, unlike the S.

Compared to the S, the Carrera 4S’ interior comes with leather upholstery on the seats, headrests, dashboard and doors as standard, along with Matrix LED headlights and wireless charging. As is typical of current 911 Carrera Coupe models, the Carrera 4S comes as a two-seater, with the option to add rear seats for no additional cost. The Cabriolet and Targa get rear seats as standard.

2025 Porsche 911 Carrera 4S engine and performance

480hp flat-six engine is only available with an 8-speed dual-clutch auto

Like the Carrera S, the 4S models use the 3.0-litre twin-turbo flat six that produces 480hp (30hp more than its predecessor) and 529Nm of peak torque. Porsche claims a 0-100kph time of 3.1 seconds with the optional Sport Chrono pack and Launch Control system, and a top speed of 307kph. The turbocharged flat-six engine comes with an 8-speed dual-clutch automatic as standard, which send power to all four wheels. The new sports exhaust seen on the Carrera S also features on the 4S.

911 Carrera 4S Targa gets rear-wheel steering as standard

The 911 Carrera 4S also shares its 408mm front disc and 380mm rear disc brakes with the Carrera S and GTS models. While the Targa version gets rear-wheel steering as standard, the Coupe and Cabriolet have it as an optional extra. Porsche Ceramic Composite Brakes (PCCB) and the brand’s sport suspension pack (which lowers the ride height by 10mm) are also available as options.

Porsche 911 India details

911 on sale in India in Carrera and Carrera 4 GTS variants

There’s no word yet on when Porsche India will introduce the 992.2 911 Carrera 4S in our country. At the moment, the current Porsche 911 is on sale in India in Carrera (Rs 2.11 crore) and Carrera 4 GTS T-Hybrid (Rs 2.84 crore) variants.
